document_data.spheres2e: [[All sphere|All]], [[Protection sphere|Protection]]<ref group="note">This spell was originally in the [[Protection sphere]] but was moved to the [[All sphere]] by the [[Player's Option: Spells & Magic]]. See page 186.
document_data.mainbody: '''''Bestow curse''''' was a [[necromancy]] or [[abjuration]] spell that handicapped a creature. The reverse of this spell was ''[[remove curse]]''.

Effects.Post-Second Sundering:
After the [[Second Sundering]], the curse changed in several ways. The curse had a one-minute duration if not used with more skill or force but a skilled caster could make the curse last for hours, or if very skilled make it permanent.
* The spell still could still lower an ability or personality trait, but it also made attempts related to the lowered trait or ability become disadvantageous. 
* Attacks from the victim against the caster would be at a disadvantage.
* As with the earlier versions, the victim could have blackouts every so often.
* The caster would cause extra necrotic damage against the victim with either spells or weapons.

The spell could be dispelled with a remove curse spell.

document_data.Components: Only verbal and somatic components were required to cast this spell.
document_data.History: The [[Netherese]] [[arcanist]] [[Enollar]] was given the credit for the creation of this spell in {{Yearlink|-1561}}.
document_data.Traditions: In the [[Mulan]] spellcasting tradition,{{cite book/Races of Faer√ªn|97}} curse-type magic was well known and used frequently.
